tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE security_camera_footage (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    camera_id INT,
    footage_url TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    duration INTERVAL
);

CREATE TABLE footage_storage (
  footage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  camera_id INT,
  footage_blob BYTEA,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (camera_id) REFERENCES security_cameras(camera_id)
);

CREATE TABLE camera_location (
    camera_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name VARCHAR,
    latitude DECIMAL,
    longitude DECIMAL,
    floor_level INT
);

CREATE TABLE footage (
    footage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    camera_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    file_name VARCHAR,
    FOREIGN KEY (camera_id) REFERENCES cameras(camera_id)
);

CREATE TABLE events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    camera_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    description VARCHAR,
    FOREIGN KEY (camera_id) REFERENCES cameras(camera_id)
);

CREATE TABLE playback (
    playback_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    footage_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES events(event_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (footage_id) REFERENCES footage(footage_id)
);

CREATE TABLE footage (
    footage_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    camera_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    footage_data BYTES,
    resolution VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE cameras (
    camera_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(50),
    model VARCHAR(50),
    installation_date DATE,
    status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE playback (
    playback_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    footage_id INT,
    playback_time TIMESTAMP,
    user_id INT,
    playback_duration INTERVAL
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(50),
    role VARCHAR(20),
    last_login TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE incidents (
    incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    footage_id INT,
    incident_description TEXT,
    incident_date DATE,
    status VARCHAR(20)
);
